item.description: did some cleaning last night before bed and this morning before work. felt good to have the bedroom all cleaned up.

oh, hello again. i’m still around! i had a very busy summer, and now with fall quickly approaching‚Äîand a free night to myself‚Äîit seemed like a good time to pull in my information from its various scattered homes both digital and physical.
yesterday was a busy day of biking! i didn’t end up getting back until very late, so i ended up doing something tonight to celebrate my half birthday and recommitting to [[obod]].
i was re-reading my last post where i said, “i don’t plan to abandon this journal.” i wasn’t kidding! it’s been a busy past few days, but i have the night mostly to myself.
soooo, i found a cute mastodon/hometown instance that’s all about pagans/witches. i’m waiting on my account to be approved, but i’ll be @autumn@pagan.
no meditation this morning. i did manage to hop on my bike and ride to the coworking office. it’s nice outside!
just realized i never did my #meditation yesterday, and i definitely forgot to do it this morning. ü•≤ oh well! today is another day, and i gotta remember to be kind to myself.
got plenty of sleep last night. even managed to squeeze in some meditation before drifting off. feeling a lot better today.
i didn’t do a very good job of respecting my body yesterday. woke up hungover. üòµ‚Äçüí´ but hey, today is a new day, and i can take it easy and make sure i do a better job this time.
happy earth day! i won’t get to do a lot of celebrating today, because i’m busy with work and then going out to dinner and a movie (the northman).
thinking, feeling, doing tarot spread the chariot: direction, control, willpower two of wands: planning, making plans, discovery page of swords: curiosity, restlessness, mental energy

yesterday’s prompt from a year and a day of everyday witchcraft was about knowing yourself. she asked the reader to list both their good and bad traits, then reflect on whether or not the “bad” traits were actually bad.
feeling grateful that the doctor was able to help with my allergies and make me comfortable again. the whole past week was pretty rough for me.

oh my, it has been awhile! between camping, volunteering at the garden, taking lots of bike rides through the woods, and spending time at the beach, i have not dedicated a whole lot of time to writing.

item.title: heat moon 2021
item.description: new moon my intention this month is to get more prepared for the commitment party. still need to get my dress, shoes, and make the centerpieces for the tables.

item.title: snake moon 2021
item.description: may 11: new moon this month is going to be all about preparing for our trial in mid-june! i’d like to spend some time in crowded, unfamiliar places to get loki used to that kind of thing.
this was my second month volunteering at the garden, and i enjoyed it just as much as the first (if not more, because it was warmer this go-around).
back in january, before i even started my obod journey, i got a letter from the arbor day foundation. thinking back on it, i think that letter may have spurred my interest in druidry again.
spotted on my walk tonight.

item.title: pollen moon 2021
item.description: april 11: new moon intention: get loki ready for competition! april 16: waxing crescent had a great lesson with alison; can’t wait to go back next week!

as part of my spring equinox celebration, i spent the morning volunteering at the well fed garden. i didn’t know what we’d be doing, but the owner explained that we’d be inoculating logs with shiitake mushrooms.
i wanted to write up a little overview of what i’m doing this weekend to celebrate the spring equinox here in the northern hemisphere.
i have a few bushes i planted last year, and they are looking rough. in an effort to save them, i put some mulch around them to hopefully keep the weed population down.

one of the projects i’ve been working on over the past year has been renaming the full moons, as the traditional names aren’t terribly relevant to the climate and wildlife where i live in the southeastern us.

i’ve been trying to decide how to write about my path with druidry. i joined the order of bards, ovates, and druids ( obod) about a month ago, and i’ve read through the first four gwersi (and the two introductory gwersi).
alban EYE-ler: spring equinox margaret reid wildflower garden showcases native plants bitches love trees. üìö to speak for the trees by diana krueger

item.title: a year and a day of everyday witchcraft
item.description: written by deborah blake, this is a book i pick up now and again when i feel like i want a little bit of inspiration on how to bring my practice back into focus.

item.title: artemis
item.description: a deity who represents physical fitness.1 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artemis ↩︎

item.title: autumn equinox
item.description: the autumn equinox occurs in september. it’s typically starting to get chilly at this point, and there’s #pumpkin flavored everything (one of my favorites).

item.title: banishing/binding spell
item.description: 2022-05-06 light a candle. as the candle is burning, write a letter to the subject of your spell, explaining why you would like them to stay away.

item.title: basil
item.description: does not smell good when burned great in food, especially tomato sauce very easy to grow, even from seed

item.title: be kind to yourself
item.description: remember to be kind to yourself, especially if you’re having a difficult day. take lots of #vacation, and use it primarily to listen to nature.

item.title: braiding sweetgrass
item.description: a beautiful book written by an indigeneous woman, robin wall-kimmerer. a hopeful memoir full of rich imagery and plenty of lessons.

item.title: cinnamon
item.description: smells delicious when burned tasty in hot cider not easy to make myself

item.title: code of conduct
item.description: guidelines to live by. think before acting listen before speaking don’t punch down uplift the marginalized be kind to yourself

item.title: commitment ceremony
item.description: invocation dearly beloved, we are gathered here today to celebrate autumn and corey as they make a promise of love and commitment to one another.

item.title: cross quarters
item.description: there are four cross quarter days: february 1, may 1, august 1, and october 31. these days occur approximately between the solstices and equinoxes.

item.title: deities
item.description: i don’t use deities a lot in my practice. i think they’re good for symbolism on occasion, and i will occasionally dedicate my cleaning or workout to one of them.

item.title: don't punch down
item.description: this aligns closely with uplift the marginalized. it’s okay to make jokes, but not at the expense of people who have it worse off than you.

item.title: druid's prayer
item.description: grant o spirit thy protection and in protection, strength and in strength, understanding and in understanding, knowledge and in knowledge, the knowledge of justice

item.title: earth day
item.description: ways to celebrate: spend some time in nature pick up trash outside

item.title: episitimi
item.description: a #discord server offshoot of sass witches, before they had their own server. a smaller community with like-minded folks who also practice #witchcraft.

item.title: equal rites
item.description: ‚ö† this page may contain spoilers. these are some notes i made while reading the book. tone reminds me of the hitchhiker’s guide.

item.title: equinoxes
item.description: the equinoxes take place in march and september, usually around the 21st-23rd of the month. being in the northern hemisphere, march is the spring equinox and september is the autumn equinox.

item.title: garden
item.description: successful harvests tomatoes basil sage rosemary bell peppers lettuce peas carrots houseplants pothos snake plant aloe üíÄ didn’t work out orchid thyme cilantro yarrow succulents (various) trees (various) broccoli planning

item.title: granny weatherwax
item.description: appears in both equal rites and wyrd sisters. introduced me to the term headology.

item.title: hestia
item.description: a deity who represents the hearth.1 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hestia ↩︎

item.title: listen before speaking
item.description: before inserting your own opinion into a conversation, think about whether or not you are centering yourself. i’m a habitual “problem solver,” and i am constantly reminding myself that no, not everybody wants advice on how to solve their problems.

item.title: lunar
item.description: the lunar cycle is celebrated in four parts. new moon, first quarter moon, full moon, and last quarter moon. these celebrations, for the most part, do not follow the modern calendar.

item.title: maintain the hearth
item.description: a tidy #hearth makes for a more relaxed mind. this goes for both the physical and #social hearth in your life.

item.title: may 1
item.description: halfway between the spring equinox and summer solstice. ways to celebrate: camping may pole bonfire appease the fae1 https://en.

item.title: meditation
item.description: primarily #mindfulness #meditation. sitting with my thoughts, #listening to them, and being okay with being #uncomfortable. headspace is a great resource for this.

item.title: new year's day
item.description: the first day of the new calendar year, january 1st. i enjoy getting together with friends, especially with a bike ride!

item.title: order of bards, ovates, and druids
item.description: i leared about druidry, and specifically obod, when a friend spoke about it. (thanks, betwixtcraft!) it wasn’t until at least a year or two later that i finally took the plunge and paid for the bardic grade course material.

item.title: pillars of practice
item.description: actions taken as part of my nature-based spirituality. adhere to the code of conduct meditate study observe solar and lunar cycles protect nature respect the body and mind maintain the hearth

item.title: protect nature
item.description: be mindful of your impact on nature. not just in the ways that you change it, but in the people, organizations, and ideas you support.

item.title: respect the body
item.description: keep your body in tune. eat using #mindfulness practices. think about where your food originates from. if you can’t stomach the way the food is made, don’t eat it.

item.title: sass witches
item.description: a subreddit dedicated to skeptic, agnostic/atheist, and science-seeking #witchcraft. i’m a participant in their #discord server.

item.title: self-love spell for healing
item.description: materials small pink candle piece of paper writing utensil envelope or sachet bag fireproof bowl lighter instructions in a comfortable place, burn a small pink candle to symbolize love.

item.title: solar
item.description: the solar cycle is celebrated on eight holidays. there are two solstices, two equinoxes, and four cross quarter days. because i live in the modern world, my year begins january 1st and ends december 31st.

item.title: solstices
item.description: the solstices take place in june and december, usually around the 21st-23rd of the month. being in the northern hemisphere, june is the summer solstice and december is the winter solstice.

item.title: spring equinox
item.description: the spring equinox occurs in march. it’s a time for renewal, regrowth, and warmth. it’s also when my gardening really kicks into gear, #camping season starts, and i can finally go #cycling more comfortably.

item.title: study
item.description: #learning is an integral part of my practice. it is ever-evolving, and so i should continue to intake new information and decide what fits into my practice.

item.title: summer solstice
item.description: on this day, the daylight is longest. i typically celebrate by going bike #camping. in 2022, i celebrated with a commitment to my partner.

item.title: tarot threes
item.description: one two three past present future stop start continue you path potential positives negatives what to do next opportunity challenge outcome theme good news energy dreams fears reality embrace accept let go history problem advice fear why it’s invalid how to overcome who you were who you are who you will be who you’re meant to be work to do sign you’ve arrived today a twist outcome head discord heart strengths weaknesses what to do with them tomorrow next week next month situation what can change what can’t change mind body spirit problem lesson advice you them the relationship situation obstacle lesson desire obstacle solution stength weakness way ahead purify prepare shine physical emotional spiritual me friend lesson

item.title: the complete idiot's guide to wicca and witchcraft
item.description: my first #introduction into #witchcraft. picked it up as a teenager and carried it around my rural indiana school. i was very edgy.

item.title: the dabbler's guide to witchcraft
item.description: these were asked as part of the sass witches book club for the dabbler’s guide to witchcraft. intro Have you ever performed a breakup ritual or other ritual that you didn’t think of as witchcraft?

item.title: the dabbler's guide to witchcraft
item.description: i’m not entirely done with this book, but since i’ve linked it on the index, i figured it was worth creating a page about it!

item.title: the nature fix
item.description: a lovely book that connects nature and mental/physical health, backed by scientific research.

item.title: think before acting
item.description: this includes things you say, and it’s tied closely to listen before speaking. the gist of this is that i would like to consider how the things i do will change the lives of not only myself, but the lives of others around me.

item.title: uplift the marginalized
item.description: this goes hand-in-hand with don’t punch down. use your privilege to uplift those who are without it. #donate to causes that uplift others.

item.title: winter solstice
item.description: on this day, the night is the longest. typically celebrated in the form of a secular christmas with family and friends.

item.title: üåë new moon
item.description: set intentions start fresh [cleaning](maintain the hearth.md)

item.title: üåì first quarter moon
item.description: beginnings ramping up planning

item.title: üåï full moon
item.description: crescendo community

item.title: üåó last quarter moon
item.description: reflection release letting go
